course_title: Special Topics in Psychology: Neuropsychology and the Fetus
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 30 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course will cover the progression of early human brain development from conception into the post-natal period up to three years. The course will review structural brain development, epochs in the maturation of the human brain during fetal life, and the effects early experience and brain trauma can have on behavioral development.
course_description: A series of special topics of concern to the discipline of psychology. Content will vary in successive offerings. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
schedule_location: MW 11:30am-12:45pm in New Psyc Bldg 225 (36 Eagle Ro
